title: Understanding $$\frac{Avoidant}{Dismissive}$$ Attachment
text: $$\frac{Avoidant}{dismissive}$$ attachment is one of the four main attachment styles identified in attachment theory. It is important to understand the characteristics that define this attachment style.

title: Characteristics of $$\frac{Avoidant}{Dismissive}$$ Attachment
text: Individuals with $$\frac{avoidant}{dismissive}$$ attachment often prioritize independence and self-reliance. They may feel uncomfortable with closeness and intimacy in relationships.

hintAnswer: a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for independence and discomfort with intimacy and closeness
title: Identifying $$\frac{Avoidant}{Dismissive}$$ Attachment
text: Which of the following best describes $$\frac{avoidant}{dismissive}$$ attachment?
choices: a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for closeness and intimacy but with a persistent fear of rejection or abandonment
a type of insecure attachment characterized by inconsistent or unpredictable behavior in caregivers, leading to confusion and fear in children
a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for independence and discomfort with intimacy and closeness
The presence of two or more distinct personality states, with a disconnection in the individual’s sense of self and actions
